content.label: I’d really enjoy playing this game on my Mac now that iPadOS apps can run on it. Please add this feature! Great game, blast from the past.

title.label: Great game just like the original pc version !

content.label: The only knock i can really think of is the buttons are pretty small on a i phone id imagine though on a ipad this wouldn’t be a problem though bigger screen and all!

title.label: I’m so excited this is available!

content.label:
I found the app a while back and some reason never posted a review. This IS the original RCT. There are no extra fees, wait times to get enough tokens, none of that like a lot of other mobile games. 

It has all the scenarios, and even a few I don’t remember. (I don’t think they’re new I was just a kid back when it was released on PC) 

I will admit, it’s a bit easier to navigate on my iPad, the iPhone screen is kind of small when placing things on the grid. But still playable. 

It’s absolutely worth the price of the app, and I highly recommend. If you liked the original, you’ll probably like this.

Okay, love this brand and could spend hours playing. It is 2020 and would love to see the brand work on the graphics. 

Tycoon really needs to start working on creating more packs like the did before so that iPad and other users can start building amazing parks as they would on PC’s.
I love this game so much!! Takes me back to the many many many hours I played as a kid. I love how it’s just as detailed as the computer one. So many fun levels to play. I could play for hours!

title.label: I want to give it 5 stars BUT...

content.label: WE NEED AN UPDATE ATARI COME ON YOU GUYS HACENT UPDATED THIS APP IN A LONG TIME. PRETTY PLEASE.

Overall the game works, but since the screen is wider and taller when menus pop off you can’t close some of them out and it’s really no point to play it cause you can’t do anything, I used to play this on my 6s  and I loved it cause it worked

The best thing about this app is it’s exactly like the original CD games. Same zoom style, same pixels, same maps, everything. It’s a blast to the past of nostalgia. Hands down my favorite game, I play it way too much as an adult, just like when I was younger spending my summer days building theme parks on my living room family computer.
Add a sandbox free play plz!

title.label: The game is good but has a small issue.

content.label: I played this game as a kid so it’s super nostalgic and good. The only issue I have with it is that my guests can’t use the restrooms and I have a path connecting the restroom and the restroom is open for operation. I lose my parks rating because of this.
I’m not a huge phone gamer but I love this game and for the price is perfect and a bit nicer than the original.

This game is really good, classic, and fun! But I would love to see a Sanbox mode were players would have infinite money and the whole map to build on with the options to choose a certain map layout or a flat one. Please add this! Thanks 😊

title.label: Finally my rct childhood fantasies can be relived

content.label: I feel like I have been waiting for this my whole life! An incredible remake of the original and it looks like even more scenarios. I love how smooth it turned out with the iPhone controls. I will be sinking many, many happy hours into this...nice job devs!!

the buttons are too wayyyy too small, and the text is too small for my taste.

additionally, parts of the UI are badly cut off because of the curved screen of the newer iphones. this is by far the worst problem, but i didnt open my review with it because i didnt want people to think it would be fine if they didnt have a newer iphone
One of my favorite games growing up I wish they would release RollerCoaster tycoon 2 for mobile though that was my favorite version of this series😕
I love this game. Thank you so much for continuing to update it!  This is a great game and well worth it.

The game is exactly the same, has few new rides, still cool. Awesome UX for iPad. My only complaint is there is one less variable to control in managing your park, ‘Park Entrance Fee’ - which was my favorite revenue source.

I read in some reviews its available in some maps, though it would be great if it was available in all maps - at parity with the original game.

title.label: Doesn’t work for iPhone 11 or 11 pro

content.label: This game hasn’t been updated for current iPhones

title.label: Doesn’t work correctly with newer iPhones

content.label: This worked great on the iPhone 8 Plus but since I got the 11 Pro Max it doesn’t work so well. The graphics are slightly worse and it doesn’t fit the screen size. Most of the time when trying to custom build a roller coaster you can’t access all the buttons and because of the screen size issue the menu is behind other screen items. Really needs to be updated to support the newer iPhones or marked that it doesn’t support the newer iPhones which would be a shame.
I loved roller coaster tycoon 2 so when I saw a Mobil version I was happy and bought it is a good a long game definitely buy the roller coster packs and why is cyan blue orange

For the most part the game is amazing. Just how I remember. Couple small things need to be fixed. I play on an iPhone X and many screens I can’t access. I can’t rename roller coasters which makes building / saving new ones a pain. Hope this can get fixed - great game.

title.label: Great game!! But a few issues

content.label: I love this game and have become addicted to it again. There is a few issues I see. When I ride breaks down and your mechanic goes to try and fix it there has been (4 times for me) a guest who is frozen in the entrance of the ride which means your mechanic can’t get in there to fix the ride. I’ve tried clicking on the guest and moving them but nothing happens. I’ve tried just about everything I can think of to fix the problem. No matter if you exit the game and go back in. Save it and go back in the guest is always still frozen in the entrance of the ride which again prevents the mechanic from being able to fix it. The only solution I’ve come up with is I have to trash the ride and re build it which is too much work to have to keep doing every time it happens. The only other issue I have come across is your janitors who sweep the paths. No matter how many you hire no matter if you give them specific jobs to do. You can have 10 janitors assigned to the same area and your guest will ALWAYS complain about the disgusting state of your path. There is one park on here I didn’t pass because guests always complain about my paths. I had 50 janitors hires and had 15 assigned to one part of the park that was the dirtiest. I would watch what they were doing and they would all walk by the piece of trash on the ground AND walk outside of there assigned areas. The only way they would sweep it up is if I picked them up and placed them on top of the spot that was dirty. Kinda a lot to do when your building a park. If these problems were fixed I wouldn’t have any issue giving this game 5 stars

Game says 5.99 yet I was charged 14.18 on 08/28/2020 at 11:54:22 am. Look I love the RCT games I started with rct 2 but overcharging just ain’t right. Either refund me the 8.19 that was over charged or just refund the whole game and I’ll gladly delete it if you don’t want to refund the 8.19. And if this review gets deleted I will just make another even if I have to make a new apple account if this one gets blocked.
I love that I can still play this game without a PC. Please, please, PLEASE give us Zoo Tycoon, too! 🙏🏻🙏🏻🙏🏻🙏🏻🙏🏻
This game brings back so many memories. I love playing it. I wish there was a Zoo Tycoon classic version too!

title.label: best roller coaster game on iphone

content.label: wish there was 2

This game brought me so much joy when i was a kid, i spent hours playing it daily for years. Every couple years i found myself redownloading this on my pc but now i don’t have to with this app, it’s always with me. I spend so much time now as an adult playing this. Well worth the cost for this app. There are a few bugs though, but nothing terrible enough to make it unplayable. Just wish they would come out with a App Store exclusive expansions or add ons to this. I’d pay for extra stuff.

title.label: Works best if you have a square screen

content.label: This game plays great on my iPad and my old iPhone 7 Plus. But since upgrading to my iPhone 11 Pro, I’ve had issues with the unique screen shape cutting off menus, keyboards and options. This makes playing the game frustrating on this device. But still great. I would rate 5 stars if the game fit my screen.

The game still works, but there is no sound whatsoever even after toggling sound off and on. The rounded corners and front camera cut out block some semi important aspects but the menus and game can still be used and you can get by still with a little struggling. I’m a bit disappointed as this is the second time I’ve purchased this game on mobile, once on Android with my old s7 and now on my iPhone.

title.label: I thinks it’s good. If only it was free

content.label:
So I have been playing this game for a while and I rlly like it. You get to start with a map of your choice. Either blank or pre made. Then make it your own while completing your goal. I even once got to year 30.

But one thing that confuses me if the price. When I first got the game, it was free, then I went to get on a friends device and it said to pay. Idk why maybe it was free for some time then became money costing. Idk but I’m still kinda upset. Like when you make ur park to expensive. 

In review if you can pay for it, this game is rlly good and fun

I have been in love with this game since I was younger I used to play it on PC, that being said I think some changes should be made. When it rains it should be clean all the Throw up off the footpaths. The scenarios should change I get the same objective with almost every level. Park guests at the end of year 3. Everything else is really awesome and is nostalgic to play!!
I bought the in app purchases and you took my money but didn't receive the content please help.

I have been a fan of this game since it originally came out on the PC years ago. I would spend hours doing a park. When I found this was finally out on iOS so I could relive some great memories, I found that this is in fact not the classic. This is a combination of RCT and RCT2. There’s nothing really wrong with that as RCT2 added some great visuals and extra little things, but the thing I did not like about RCT2 is that it would block you from doing certain things that were possible in the classic RCT such as entrance fee. I get this may be part of a scenario in some instances, but if it isn’t explicitly for the scenario, we should still be able to have the option of doing an entrance fee instead of it being blocked.

Overall, I love this game and happy to be able to play it again, but I would rather have the RCT classic the way it was than having a blend. At the very least if there is going to be a blend, then perhaps just pull in some of the coaster designs or graphics from the RCT2 but keep the functionality the same as RCT classic.

I never review anything but I don’t know another way to get it across. 
It’s a great game and plays almost exactly like I remember it from the good old days playing on my computer, but that being said, you literally cannot use the custom track maker because the button to close the editor is covered by the park rating meter. Like... you can’t do it. It’s not possible. I’d be glad to give 5 stars but there’s a genuinely unusable feature that I really would like to use. Fix that and you’ve got 5 stars all day every day.

I cannot rave about this port enough. After playing for countless hours and experiencing minimal bugs, this game is exactly as it was when I played it as a kid. No garbage in-app purchase system to ruin the gameplay. The one time purchase is worth every penny.

I love that this is available on iOS. I remember as a kid putting hours into this game on pc. It’s still just as fun as it was all those years ago. My only complaint is the size of the buttons but that’s minor compared to how great the rest of the game is.

I remember the first time my family computer was too new to run RCT2. I was distraught and asked my parents for a windowsXP desktop JUST so I could play RCT2. Fast forward to Atari going bankrupt and chris saying that his best game ever was RCT. Then they release that pile of crap RCT4mobile. Let’s take everything good about the franchise and switch it out for a pay to play bailout for atari. NO. BAD ATARI. THIS IS WHY YOU WENT BANKRUPT. PAC-MAN WORLD3 WAS A MISTAKE!

Then they wised up and did the simplest thing in the world. They ported RCT1&2 to mobile and charged $6. I would have been happy to pay $20 for it. Thank you Atari.

Only complaints-
First complaint. the game ignores the curved edges on the new iPhones and makes pressing buttons hard. Have to rotate the phone to get stuff done. 
Second complaint. There is a bug with some rollercoasters and the more you rebuild them the lower the excitement rating drops, which isn’t a problem in most scenarios, but impossible when you are playing the partially built coaster scenarios.

I can’t okay this game right in my iPhone! Sometimes the build icon gets stuck on the far left corner and I can’t do anything about it. Can you change the screen size or something? I used to play it just fine on my iPhone SE but now I can’t with this bigger phone! And I bought the expansion packs and everything ☹️

If you are looking for the classic RCT game you have found it!!! It’s almost identical to the PC version. There are a few differences. 

PROS

-When you build the walking paths or the queue lines, if there is a tree in the way you can build on it and it will automatically remove the tree, whereas in the pc game it says “tree in the way.”

-The rides and food places have dollar amounts pop up every time something is sold, giving you a much better idea of what’s selling and what’s not.

-The rides give you an option to “include scenery” so if you want your ride decorated and already have a queue lines and exit paths attached you can, but it will cost more to build that way. But you can also turn it off if you’d like to make it cheaper.

CONS

-I am playing it on my iPhone 8, so because of that the buttons are REALLY small and you may tap the wrong thing sometimes. It’s a little tough to place your handymen, guards, mechanics, and entertainers. A stylus would be recommended if you are playing on a phone to make it a bit easier!

-You can’t charge an entrance fee for your park, it’s free to get in. But to counter that, in this version you can just make the rides, food, etc a lot more expensive than you normally would in the PC version but the customers won’t complain about it (unless you make it WAY too high) As an example I charged $10 for a ride on the Crazy Caterpillar coaster. Queue line stayed full! 

All things considered I would highly recommend this game and it’s totally worth the $6!!

Because developers don't update at all, the game screen breaks on the new resolution device. They haven't updated for more than two years. Perhaps they won't do it in the future. but they keep selling dlc. Good job. atari.

Hi there. iPhone XR. Main menu needs the option to adjust screen size, or adjust the location of interface buttons along edges. Unable to tap on them makes it difficult to play my favorite mobile game. The 4 corners need to scoot inward towards center. During game: the adjust land button, the pause game button, the globe button, & the park menu button - are all inaccessible & can’t be used. Please fix.

The nostalgia is real with this one. It’s exactly the same as the original RCT games right down to the controls and graphics. What I’m wondering now is if they’re also developing the original Zoo Tycoon games for us to play.

title.label: Love it but issues with building custom coasters

content.label: For some reason I can never make the final piece of my custom coaster track connect back with the starting platform, even with triple checking if the track and platform pieces fit together within the game. Don’t know if this is a glitch but would love to finish creating my coaster!

title.label: A little amazing a little shakey

content.label: For those of you who have some fond memories of playing roller coaster tycoon 1 or 2 while younger or have seen YouTube video and want to get into the game, here is what I have to say about Roller coaster tycoon classic. Only buy classic for mobile. $6 is an amazing price for an actual video game compared to buying micro transactions in “free” mobile games. This game isn’t perfect on mobile (no update for the newer phones so it is cropped out but I play this on an iPad) and you have to pay extra to download parks and rides created by people (such as the useful rides from the Marcel Vos guides). But besides that, this is a great real game to play on your phone or iPad and sink hours into.

title.label: Great game, terrible support for newer iPads

content.label: I previously played this on my iPad Air 1 where it looked great and enjoyed playing it. After upgrading to an iPad Air 3 I looks terrible! What the heck!? Update your app!

title.label: By far my favorite tablet game

content.label: I’ve played this game on computer since it was released and it’s got such a well balanced and designed gameplay, there’s just nothing quite like it in modern apps. I try other games, so many different games, but I never find myself wanting to go back to them after a few sessions. This game is different. I’ve paid far bigger money for console games that I don’t spend nearly as much time on or get nearly as much enjoyment, relaxation, and satisfaction from. And for a tablet game I absolutely love not having ads or timer countdown locks on features. Extremely worth it to pay the money (such a small amount too compared to the combo of original pc software it contains) and get a complete game free of ad and pay to win hell. Thanks again to the rtc team for making this awesome game and bringing it life again in a new format.

title.label: Perfect if they’d fix the edges.

content.label: Other reviews have mentioned the problems with newer iPhones and notches and null zones. It’s really a pain.

I don’t leave many reviews, but something must be said. Don’t get me wrong, this game is amazing if you love tycoon style games. I have been a fan of it since it came out on PC (RCT3 is just okay. There is some kind of magic to be had in RCT, RCT2, and this one, essentially both combined.) You manage a park with finances, simply put. Game has multiple “scenarios” that require you to perform certain tasks in order to win - quite fun and interesting.
My biggest beef lately is that on the new curved iPhone screens, and especially the “null zone” near the top of the screen where the camera etc are are essentially ignored by the game. This makes selecting the “Adjust Land” option, the “Settings” option a repetitious endeavor, and spoiler: both of these are very useful and will be pressed FREQUENTLY...or at least, you will try to. The park info button in the top left is hard to press as well, but not used as frequently. Park map in top right is big enough that it is not an issue. But the other corners...and my eyes brightened when this just got a new update..!! But alas..these issues ignored.
Am I trying to deter you? Not at all. Great game, but unfortunately, probably more suited for anything less than the newest phone, or on an iPad, which to me kind of alienates a big group of players, myself included.
I will be waiting for the day I can complete the scenarios on my phone. Until that time, ride and scream, friends.
The game is everything I had hoped it would be!  It brings back such happy memories and the gameplay is easy and bug free.  Well worth the purchase...don’t hesitate!
Just want an update so the screen isn’t obscured by the newest iPhone design (11 pro max)
